source.main.analysis module

File used for the analysis.

class source.main.analysis.Analysis(region, dl)[source]

Bases: object

Analysis Class that runs the differents functions needed.

source_bucket

Source bucket of the logs

Type:

str

output_bucket

Output bucket of the results

Type:

str

region

Region in which the tool is executed

Type:

str

results

Object where the results of the functions are written

Type:

dict

dl

True if the user wants to download the results, False if he wants the results to be written in a s3 bucket

Type:

bool

path

Where to write the results locally

Type:

str

time

Time when the class were executed (to add to the path)

Type:

str

Initiates athena database and table for further analysis

Replace the table name of the ddl file by database.table

results_query(id, query)[source]

Print the results of the query and where they are written

merge_results()[source]

Merge the results csv files in one single xlsx file

clear_folder(dl)[source]

If results written locally, delete the tmp bucket created for the analysis. If results written in a bucket, clear the bucket so the .metadata and .txt are deleted

is_trail_bucket(catalog, db, table)[source]

Verify if a table source bucket is a trail bucket

clear_folder(dl)[source]

If results written locally, delete the tmp bucket created for the analysis. If results written in a bucket, clear the bucket so the .metadata and .txt are deleted.

Parameters:

dl (bool) – True if the user wants to download the results, False if he wants the results to be written in a s3 bucket

dl = None
execute(source_bucket, output_bucket, catalog, db, table, queryfile, exists, timeframe)[source]

Handle the main function of the class.

Parameters:

  • source_bucket (str) – Source bucket

  • output_bucket (str) – Output bucket

  • catalog (str) – Data catalog used with the database

  • db (str) – Database containing the table for logs analytics

  • table (str) – Contains the sql requirements to query the logs

  • queryfile (str) – File containing the queries

  • exists (tuple of bool) – If the input db and table already exists

  • timeframe (str) – Time filter for default queries

init_athena(db, table, source_bucket, output_bucket, exists, isTrail)[source]

Initiate athena database and table for further analysis.

Parameters:

  • db (str) – Database used

  • table (str) – Table used

  • source_bucket (str) – Source bucket of the logs of the table

  • output_bucket (str) – Bucket where to put the results of the queries

  • exists (bool) – If the given db and table already exists

  • isTrail (bool) – if the source bucket of the table is a bucket trail

is_trail_bucket(catalog, db, table)[source]

Verify if a table source bucket is a trail bucket.

Parameters:

  • catalog (str) – Catalog of the database and table

  • db (str) – Database of the table

  • table (str) – Table of the logs

Returns:

isTrail – if the trail has a specified bucket

Return type:

bool

execute(services, regionless)[source]

Handle the main function of the class. Run every enumeration function and then write the results where asked.

Parameters:

  • services (list) – Array used to write the results of the different enumerations functions

  • regionless (str) – “not-all” if the tool is used on only one region. First region to run the tool on otherwise

Returns:

self.services – Object where the results of the functions are written

Return type:

object

execute_analysis(queryfile, exists, timeframe)[source]

Run the logs analysis main function.

Parameters:

  • queryfile (str) – File containing the queries to run

  • exists (tuple of bool) – Array containing information about if the db and table exists

  • timeframe (str) – Timeframe used in the query to filter results

execute_configuration(regionless)[source]

Run the configuration main function.

Parameters:

regionless (str) – ‘not-all’ if the tool is used on only one region. First region to run the tool on otherwise

Run the logs extraction main function.

Parameters:

  • regionless (str) – ‘not-all’ if the tool is used on only one region. First region to run the tool on otherwise

  • start (str) – Start date of the logs collected

  • end (str) – End date of the logs collected

download_rds(nameDB, rds, logname)[source]

‘Download’ the rds logs

Parameters:

  • nameDB (str) – name of the rds instance

  • rds (object) – RDS client

  • logname (str) – name of the logfile to get

Returns:

ret – Part of the response

Return type:

dict

execute(services, regionless, start, end)[source]

Main function of the class. Run every logs extraction function and then write the results where asked

Parameters:

  • services (list) – Array used to write the results of the different configuration functions

  • regionless (str) – “not-all” if the tool is used on only one region. First region to run the tool on otherwise

  • start (str) – Start time for logs collection

  • end (str) – End time for logs collection
